business.headline: Dormant account? Here's how to easily reactivate it at SBI, PNB and 2 more banksKeep your bank account active with periodic transactions and KYC updates. Reactivate dormant accounts at HDFC, PNB, SBI, and IDFC FIRST Banks with simple steps.

ITC shares rise as ITC Hotels demerger set for January 1, 2025: Key detailsITC Hotels demerger announcement came after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT), Kolkata Bench, approved the scheme of arrangement between ITC and ITC Hotels.

How big corporates are choking middle class, hurting India growth storyThe government gave tax relief to private companies in 2019 hoping they would invest in people and infrastructure. It was counterproductive. Big corporates pocketed profits and froze real wages of employees. Here's why the government should take a decisive step to ensure more money in the hands of the middle class to boost India's growth story.
Traffic challans in Delhi? Know how to get them waived off starting December 20Delhi Police launches Evening Court sessions from December 20 to clear pending traffic fines.

Dam Capital IPO: Check opening date, price band, gmp, issue details  DAM Capital Advisors' IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders.

Concord Enviro IPO opening date: Check GMP, price band, other detailsThe Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 500.33 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 0.25 crore shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 0.46 crore shares worth Rs 325.33 crore.

Billionaire blues for Ambani, Adani as networth slips below $100 billionReliance Industries, Mukesh Ambani's flagship company, has faced pressure in its core businesses. However, market analysts remain cautiously optimistic.

Swiggy share price hits all-time high today. Here's what drove the rallySwiggy stock: Swiggy made its stock market debut on November 13, listing at a 7.69% premium. The stock opened at Rs 420 per share on the NSE, compared to its IPO price of Rs 390.

Bitcoin hits record high, soars over $106,000. 3 things to knowBitcoin, the world's leading cryptocurrency, reached a record high above $106,000, driving positive momentum in other cryptos.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: One Nation One Election bill be sent to Parliament panel, PM suggested: Amit Shah LIVE UPDATESThe One Nation, One Election Bill was tabled in the Lok Sabha today (December 17), triggering protests from the opposition.

Omar Abdullah echoes Amit Shah on Congress and EVMsJust a day before Omar Abdullah set the cat among the pigeons by dismissing his ally Congress's objection to EVMs, Home Minister Amit Shah used a similar line of attack to deflate the opposition party's charge.

How Indira Gandhi's 1970 decision was final nail in One Poll coffinIndia's democratic journey began with simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and state Assemblies. The Congress-led Centre's dismissing of state governments decoupled elections in some states. However, it was Indira Gandhi's decision in 1970 that ended synchronised elections in India.

Grit, message and reward: KL Rahul's insider view of Akash-Bumrah Gabba heroicsAustralia vs India, 3rd Test: KL Rahul reflected on the emotions in the Indian dressing room after Akash Deep and Jasprit Bumrah's heroic last-wicket partnership helped them avoid the follow-on in Brisbane.

Here's why the government should take a decisive step to ensure more money in the hands of the middle class to boost India's growth story.

Noida officials made to stand for 30 minutes for making elderly couple waitNoida Authority Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Lokesh M directed the officials of the residential plot department to work in standing position after noticing that an elderly couple had been standing for 50 minutes and no official was attending them.

Asia unfolded: 2024's defining moments in photosA photo story showcasing the pivotal events and vibrant celebrations that shaped Asia's journey in 2024, spanning politics and culture alike.

British-Indian gets life in jail; killed mother, tried to bury body in gardenA 48-year-old Indian-origin man has been sentenced to life in jail for murdering his 76-year-old mother in their Leicester home. Sindeep Singh killed his mother, Bhajan Kaur, over a dispute over their family home, and dug a hole in the garden to bury the body.
This SUV sold more than Seltos, Curvv, Hyryder combined in NovemberWith 15,452 units sold in November 2024, this model was the largest-selling mid-size SUV during the month.

CNN frees Syrian prisoner. He turns out to be Assad regime's torturer: ReportThe man told CNN he had been imprisoned for three months. However, investigations by a Syrian fact-checking organisation revealed that the man is a former first lieutenant in Assad's air force intelligence.
Rapper Badshah fined in Gurugram for traffic rule violationBollywood rapper Badshah was fined by Gurugram Traffic Police for driving on the wrong side after attending Karan Aujla's concert.

No temple found in Sambhal, says UP Samajwadi Party chief, stokes controversySpeaking on the re-opening of the temple, Uttar Pradesh Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Shyam Lal Pal said that no temple has been found anywhere and the BJP has snatched away people's peace in the state.

'I want to go to kidnap you': Gurugram resident's frightening chat with Uber driverThe Gurugram resident claimed they received a rather disturbing message from the Uber driver - "I want to go to kidnap you happily" - which subsequently led them to cancel the ride and head home in fear.

With winter comes joint pain: How to stay fitterThe discomfort is often linked to preexisting arthritic conditions, reduced mobility or increased muscle stiffness, all of which can get aggravated by colder temperatures

Diljit Dosanjh clarifies 'no concerts in India' remarkSinger Diljit Dosanjh clarified that he won't perform in Chandigarh due to inadequate venue infrastructure. Addressing the controversy sparked by his earlier statement, he emphasised that this decision does not apply to all of India.

66-year-old wins 24-year battle for law school admission in GujaratAt the age of 66 years, Shashikumar Mohta has finally won a 24-year legal battle for admission into Gujarat University's LLB programme.

The struggles of pet owners no one talks about in IndiaIndian pet parents, especially dog owners, feel that India is yet to become more accommodating for pets. There are several struggles that often go unnoticed despite the ever-growing Indian pet market.

Indian vlogger travels on top of moving train in Bangladesh to record video, slammed The Indian vlogger was seen lying on top of the moving train in Bangladesh while recording the now-viral video. He admitted that the stunt was rather dangerous and urged viewers to refrain from trying it.

Russian general killed in Moscow, Ukraine's security service claims responsibilityLieutenant General Igor Kirillov, head of Russia's Nuclear, Biological, and Chemical Defence Forces (NBC), was leaving a residential block when an explosive hidden in a scooter went off, Russia's Investigative Committee said.

US blogger slams Air India for 'worst business class experience ever', shares video Among his complaints, Drew Binsky claimed that his seat was non-reclining and broken, while the table was completely unusable, forcing him to eat his meal on a pillow that was allegedly "covered in human hair."

Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo's Wicked sequel title announcedThe sequel to Jon M Chu's Wicked is officially titled Wicked For Good, referencing a pivotal duet between Elphaba and Glinda. The first installment, which released on November 22, has surpassed $500 million globally.

Mahira Khan on viral smoking pic with Ranbir: Wouldn't get out of bedPakistani actor Mahira Khan reflected on the emotional and professional challenges she faced after her viral photos with Ranbir Kapoor emerged. The actress shared how the incident affected her both personally and career-wise.

Director Vignesh Shivan clarifies comments on meeting Ajith Kumar: Stop mockingIn a recent interview, director Vignesh Shivan revealed that he met Ajith in 2015, who praised Naanum Rowdy Dhaan. After netizens questioned a timeline discrepancy, the filmmaker has now clarified the matter on his Instagram stories.

Diljit Dosanjh's perfect Kashmir getaway with kahwa, rabab on shikara in Dal LakeDiljit Dosanjh embarks on a spiritual journey in Kashmir, sharing serene moments with his fans. The artist explores cultural landmarks and enjoys traditional experiences in the picturesque valley.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli-Gambhir celebration for escaping follow-on divides opinionsIND vs AUS: Senior batter Virat Kohli and head coach Gautam Gambhir celebrated animatedly after India avoided follow-on in the Brisbane Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. The celebrations earned mixed reactions from fans who were not happy given India's position in the Test match.

Santner takes 4 as New Zealand win 3rd Test to give Southee fond farewellNew Zealand clinched a massive 423-run victory over England as Tim Southee bid farewell in his final Test match. Despite resistance from Bethell and Root, England succumbed to a dramatic collapse on day four.

Greatest slip catch? Watch Steve Smith redeem himself with stunning KL Rahul effort Australia vs India, 3rd Test: Steve Smith dropped KL Rahul's catch in the very first delivery of Day 4 in Brisbane. However, he pulled off a sensational catch at first slip to dismiss the Indian opener later in the session.

Virat Kohli bats at extra net session after first innings failure at GabbaAustralia vs India, 3rd Test: Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill were at the nets on Tuesday morning even when India were batting in their first innings. Kohli hit a lot of balls during the additional training session at the Gabba.

Gabba Test: Josh Hazlewood suffers fresh injury, bowls just 1 over on Day 4Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood suffered a fresh injury as he was forced off the field on Day 4 of the Gabba Test on Tuesday, December 17. Hazlewood would bowl just one over before heading off the field.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
